alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:27PM EST until January 09 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Greenville County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 500 PM EST. * At 227 PM EST, River gauges were depicting ongoing flooding along the Reedy, Brushy Creek and Enoree Basins and flooding of low-lying areas will linger through the late afternoon. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
